page.title: 13Care for the elderly
page.content: Sanquhar is a close knit community which cares for its elderly. A block of 9 Sheltered houses with resident warden has been provided by the District Council. The health board supervises health visitors, a nightly "bedding" service and a geriatric hospital and day centre 12 miles south of town. The Social Work department organises meals-on-wheels (21 daily), employs home-helps for 64 persons and runs an Old Folks' home 12 miles away. This department provides occupational therapy and aids for the elderly, as well as special support for the blind and deaf. Local people have organised a Pensioners' Club, a Luncheon Club and a Friends & Neighbours Club, and there are branches of WRVS, ARC and Crossroads (Care Attendant Scheme). Recently a "Wheels Appeal" provided a mini-bus for the aged and disabled.
